data.title: Great place for good food & cocktails!
data.text: We asked the waitress to pick some different dishes for us, and every dish was superb in both taste and look! I'll be back! :)

data.title: I'd like a membership at this club!
data.text:
Wow... I thought Tar and Roses was my favorite Santa Monica restaurant but now it's a toss up. Andrew has done it again with his newest restaurant - SMYC, located on the other end of the block. It has a different vibe and menu than T&R. Both are charming, unpretentious and serve phenomenal food! Loved the sophisticated nautical theme done with quality finishes - teak beams overhead, glass fishing balls, rock art sculpture, enclosed patio, bar backlighting. Noise level is perfect for conversations. 
Service is attentive, friendly. Top quality fresh ingredients, nice portion sizes. Some favs from T&R menu found here too (mussels in Thai green sauce and whole snapper). Overall SMYC menu leans towards fusion seafood selections. Served family style, I suggest 1-2 small plate choices per person and share, you'll want to taste everything. Pace it slowly, along with signature cocktails. Don't forget to try a couple of desserts. Oh that hazelnut brownie and ice cream!

data.title: Wow, Wow and Wow!!!
data.text:
My wife were in Los Angeles for 10 days and we asked the concierge at the hotel to find us a dinner reservation on Friday afternoon for that evening. She found us a 9 pm table at SMYC. From the moment we walked in and we were greeted warmly and taken immediately to our table - actually we were given a choice of three which was great. Most of the plates are designed to be shared. We started off with the raw menu having tuna tartare which was absolutely fab and full of flavour. We followed up with yellowtail that was the perfect combination of spicy (green chilis and ricotta cheese). It only got better from there...

Rick shrimp dumplings, lobster and burrata on toast, lobster rice, blackened catfish on a bed of lemon risotto and brussel sprouts with goat cheese and god knows what else - every single dish was perfectly prepared and absolutely delicious. The arrive was excellent and attentive but not invasive in the least. 

A terrific meal and experience and one that I strongly recommend for anyone who finds themselves on the west side of LA for an evening!

data.title: Great atmosphere, drinks, and food
data.text: The Santa Monica YC is not near any water, but the nautical theme is really well done and tasteful.  Lovely bar with speciality drinks.  Had the rock shrimp dumplings, half chicken, and corn.  Everything was perfectly cooked and tasted great.  Next time will try the deep fried snapper - seemed a bit bigger than what we were looking for but it's an impressive looking dish!

data.title: Great food
data.text: Only stayed in LA for two nights and the food was so good we dined here both nights. The staff were fantastic, attentive and very helpful. The food was incredible. I would definitely recommend eating here if you are ever in the Santa Monica region. Well worth it

data.title: Allsummer16
data.text: Stop here after going to USA Men's basketball game at Staples Center. It was a great summer night. A lot of people out.

data.title: Best meal of our California trip
data.text: We loved this restaurant so much we booked to come back for our final night of the holiday. The fish was incredible especially the Dover Sole and the octopus. We loved everything that we ate on both occasions. Cocktails were incredible and staff were very friendly. Perfect for a special night out.

data.title: Californien See Food
data.text:
Hey it's simple. You want perfect californien food? It's the place. Good cocktail amazing side dishes and very good fish. Additional to that the waitress are very friendly. 
Great experience!

data.title: Amazing!
data.text:
SNYC has wonderful seafood small plates, raw bar and a great cocktail program. You can choose between raw, fish, crustacean, meat and delicious garden sides for the perfect meal.

The Yellowtail was the best that I've ever had.  I love the combination of cultures in the tastes.

One of items that they are famous for is the fried, whole snapper.  Everyone at the other tables were ordering this and raving.  We'll try it the next time we are there.

data.title: Great New Find
data.text: After a month in Italy, we took a detour through Santa Monica to decompress before returning to Silicon Valley. This new spot combines high quality seafood with Small Plates. Nice selection of regional beers and fresh local catches. I loved my halibut, lots of passion in the kitchen.

data.title: Had a nice dinner here with great food, service and atmosphere.
data.text:
Loved the peach and tomato salad, excellent fresh oysters, and soft shell crab for starters. We also tried the catfish which my husband loved and i had the dover sole. It was exquisite. My friend sent me there based on her loving the dover sole and compared to the amount that Melisse charges for the same thing, it was a bargain! 
Excellent cocktails i loved the lulu lime and the watermelon gimlet. Our server was attentive without being over bearing or cloying and the wait staff had things whoosed away in perfect time. 
We will be back!

data.title: Amazing fresh ingredients
data.text:
I had heard really good things about Andrew Kirschner. Everything good was very accurate.
He actually allows the food to speak for itself. All his flavours really work perfectly together.
The dishes are perfectly balanced. Not a heavy dish among them.
The shell fish are all sushi quality. 
You cannot mistake the level of the quality.
The soft shell crab was terrific.  The scallop ceviche was fresh and wonderful. 
The Dover sole was deboned at the table. Beautifully cooked, served and prepared.
The potato wedges were like thicker great french fries.
The duck breast was amazing. 
Perfectly cooked and really good quality.
The desserts, hazel nut brownie was scrumptious. The ice cream was rich but not overly so.
The fruit berry tart with the crispy shell was fantastic.
I cannot wait to go back.
The servers including Brad were very attentive. Everyone who worked along side him really did their job.
Thank you everyone for making this such a great meal.
This is a perfect example of what five star dining should be.

data.title: Great Seafood
data.text: OK, it's not actually a yacht club - it sits on Santa Monica Blvd. a number of blocks away from the water. There doesn't seem to be a sign, but it does have a group of white and blue sailing flags in wood by the door. You can park in the parking building next to the library up the street (about $1) or you can use their valet parking, which will be $8+. The space is light and modern, which comfortable chairs and an upbeat feeling. I like the decor better than their sister restaurant, Tar and Roses, up the street. As you might expect, they feature seafood and it's wonderful seafood. I had scallop ceviche with watermelon-juice cubes and other goodies and it was great, as was the grilled octopus and the mussels in some kind of very tasty sauce. The service was excellent and the bill was moderate. Next time, we will get the whole fish that many others had ordered, served in a dramatic way, as though the fish was still swimming. Great show, great food.

data.title: This is the best restaurant in Santa Monica
data.text:
Imagine you took the best of Asian and European flavors, combined with sophisticated American seafood, and served them with adroit tapas-like combinations at a surprisingly reasonable price.  That's this place.  It's a little hard to describe because the menu changes and there are different options, but everything is ridiculously delicious, including the cocktails.  The service and decour are very nice but the star is the food.  

Warning:  DO NOT LEAVE HERE WITHOUT ORDERING DESSERT. You must order the fruit crostada.  Almost everyone we know that has been there (foodies all) claims this is the best dessert they have ever had.  Anywhere.

data.title: Every dish was great!
data.text: I went to this restaurant with my wife in early June.  We made reservation a week earlier.  The place was packed by 6:30 pm.  The atmosphere was nice and the service was great.  We ordered 6 small dishes and a bottle of wine.  Everyone of the dishes was tasted great!  However, my favorites were Charred Octopus (very small, but unbelievable taste), Lobster toast and Albacore Poke.

data.title: Diverse/eclectic/neuvo
data.text: This place is on the small side, but the menu has a lot to offer. Many items presented in a new way. Most impressive is a beautifully presented entire snapper. The sugar peas are refreshingly unique and tasty. Soft shell crab as you'd expect...but served on a bed of a chutney like mixture. Charred octopus. Lobster and burrata toast. Spicy shrimp dumplings. Clams with spicy pasta. All good! Space is a bit dark and loud.

data.title: Beautiful Restaurant. Great Food. Great Service
data.text: I don't know how Santa Monica restaurants do it, but I cannot remember ever having a bad experience with service.  Ever.  The food here was excellent, if a bit pricey,  Owner came over to find out how our meals were and chit-chat for a bit.  First dinner with my son and daughter in a very long time, and SMYC helped to make it great.  If you like chocolate, leave room for their chocolate brownie sundae.  Best ever.

data.title: Good food, interestingly prepared, and a good wine selection
data.text:
We chose to dine here for our business dinner and made a reservation which was honored, but this establishment is very, very popular so that you may not be seated in an ideal location. We concentrated on the sea food and began with a selection of oysters which were divine. We then opted for the bronzino and the sword fish, the former as a skin on grilled fillet, the later prepared with an accompanying sauce, cooked to a pink, deliciously tender interior. This was accompanied by a bottle of white wine. We ended the meal with key lime pie and an apple-tart confection served with vanilla ice cream.

both of which were cooked to perfection--the sword fish

data.title: Terrific food, fun staff, cool atmosphere
data.text: We ate at the Santa Monica Yacht Club over Valentine's weekend, and had a terrific experience. Although I don't usually go for mixed drinks, the jars of fresh, handmade mixers lining the bar were too tempting to pass up. I asked the bartender, Cody, for something delicious with mint and ginger and he made me an incredibly yummy, refreshing cocktail. The manager, Josh, broke down the menu for us in great detail and enthusiasm. We started off with the stripped bass ceviche and mussels in green curry - both delicious and unique - and then dove into the fried red snapper. Having a whole fried fish on our table brought back memories of Southeast Asian food from our traveling days. The presentation was awesome and the fish was fantastic. And we had a visit from Chef Andrew. All in all a lovely night.

data.title: Diverse food with a creative flair (and a great "buzz")
data.text:
Incredibly diverse selection of seafood dishes with a real creative flair.  The trout didn't have a single bone - highly unusual even for the best places - and the lobster toast appetizer was a standout.  If you occasionally imbibe there's a list of hand-crafted cocktails with ingredients that you'll have to ask the (knowledgable) staff about. 

The desert brownie was a tad dry but sufficiently chocolatey to satisfy several of the chocoholics at the table.  

A nice buzz, not too loud and didn't feel rushed once.  The prices seemed a bit high but not outrageous for a restaurant that good and in that neighborhood.  I'd come back and would recommend it to others.
